thread.title: Gov. John Bel Edwards: Louisiana fortunate to escape fatal injuries after tornadoes, but damage significant
thread.title_full: Gov. John Bel Edwards: Louisiana fortunate to escape fatal injuries after tornadoes, but damage significant

author: Advocate staff report
title: Gov. John Bel Edwards: Louisiana fortunate to escape fatal injuries after tornadoes, but damage significant
text:
( â€¦ ) Advocate staff photo by MATTHEW HINTON 
Tornado damage is seen on Bundy Road in New Orleans East, La. Tuesday, Feb. 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Debris sits on streets in New Orleans East after severe weather rolled through in New Orleans, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Homes and cars sit damaged in the wake of the tornado that touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Neighbors support each other in the wake of the tornado that touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Tornado victims and neighbors walk around to spect the damage after a tornado touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Trees are up rooted along Chef Menteur Highway after a tornado touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Gregory Rugon looks out from his home to tell a neighbor he is okay after a tornado touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Gregory Rugon climbs out of his kitchen into his living room in the wake of the tornado that touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Power lines lean after a tornado touches down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
A tree lies on a car after a tornado touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. Advocate staff photo by SOPHIA GERMER 
Lisa Carruth tears up on her street in the wake of the tornado that touched down in New Orleans East, La., Tuesday February 7, 2017. TownNews.com Content Exchange 
Louisiana Gov. John Bel Edwards said seven tornadoes touched down in the southeast part of the state Tuesday, injuring dozens and causing significant damage in Orleans, Livingston, Tangipahoa, Ascension and St. James parishes. 
There have been no fatalities, Edwards said. A city of New Orleans spokesperson said there are at least 25 injuries the city itself; three of those have serious but non-life-threatening injuries. 
State Police and the National Guard will be in New Orleans East on Tuesday night to prevent looting, Edwards said. 
Of the seven twisters, two were in Orleans Parish, two in Livingston Parish and one each in Tangipahoa, Ascension and St. James parishes, Edwards said. Related
